Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Studio \Stu"di*o\, n.; pl. {Studios}. [It. studio, properly, study. See {Study}.] The working room of an artist. [1913 Webster]

studio n 1: workplace for the teaching or practice of an art; "she ran a dance studio"; "the music department provided studios for their students"; "you don't need a studio to make a passport photograph" 2: an apartment with a living space and a bathroom and a small kitchen [syn: {studio apartment}] 3: workplace consisting of a room or building where movies or television shows or radio programs are produced and recorded
